text:
Now that sphinx-gallery has been merged in nilearn (hurray!!). We can start converting some example to use the notebook-style example.

The first candidate is probably the plotting examples.
title: Use the new sphinx-gallery notebook-style example
Use the new sphinx-gallery notebook-style example

text: For reference: the corresponding sphinx-gallery docs: http://sphinx-gallery.readthedocs.org/en/latest/tutorials/index.html#notebook-styled-examples
Should we not do a sphinx-gallery release, revive #592 and merge it before we can think about using notebook-style examples in nilearn ?

> Should we not do a sphinx-gallery release, revive #592 and merge it before we
> can think about using notebook-style examples in nilearn ?

I don't know. I lost track :$

yes we are missing a PyPI realease of sphinx-gallery with the notebook examples.
The we can rebase #592 to correctly adopt the images and references naming convention that meanwhile got adopted when the notebook examples pull request passed.

It's probably worth looking at the issues (and me at my notes if I can find them) to see whether there were still things to iterate on before the next sphinx-gallery release. I seem to remember the naming conventions still weren't that consistent but I could be wrong.
I did this over the week end. Closing.
